trial_identification.studytitle: Comparative study of audiometrics tests on metallurgical workers exposed to noise only as well as noise associated to the chemical products handling.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Comparative study of audiometrics tests on metallurgical workers exposed to noise only as well as noise associated to the chemical products handling.

interventions.interventions: to perform a comparative study, through audiometrics tests, of workers exposed to noise only as well as noise associated to the chemical products. 71 metallurgists exposed to noise and chemical products (group II) for a period that varies from 3 to 20 years.The workers were exposed to noise from heavy machinery and chemicals such as styrene, acetone, resin, cobalt, among others.
interventions.comparator: 81 metallurgists exposed to noise(group I) for a period that varies from 3 to 20 years.The range of noise dBNA wobbled between 80.5 and 99.5 dBNA, and the exposure time was 8 hours a day.

primaryOutcome.outcome: occupational hearing loss in the group I through audiometric tests
primaryOutcome.timepoint: After an average of 7.6 years of exposure

primaryOutcome.outcome: occupational hearing loss in the group II through audiometric tests
primaryOutcome.timepoint: After an average of 6.1 years of exposure

secondaryOutcome.outcome: right ear occupational hearing loss in the group II through audiometric tests

ethicsAndSummary.summary: to perform a comparative study, through audiometrics tests, of workers exposed to noise only as well as noise associated to the chemical products. The hypothesis is that the Group II will have higher prevalence of occupational hearing loss when compared to group I.
